frame.name: Verification
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Inspector</fen> attains a degree of certainty in the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>, generally by inspecting some evidence.
<ex><fex name="Medium">This note</fex> <t>confirms</t> <fex name="Unconfirmed_content">my suspicions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Inspector
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
<ex><fex name="ins">His</fex> later <t>verification</t> of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unconfirmed_content
FE.definition:
<def-root>An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence. It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
<ex>It is extremely difficult to <t>confirm</t> <fex name="unc">the absence of something</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the verification which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Inspector</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action performed by the <fen>Inspector</fen> by which the <fen>Inspector</fen> manages to establish the truth of the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>.
<ex>We <t>confirmed</t> our results <fex name="mea">by repeating the experiment and measuring the output with a mass spec</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of certainty which the <fen>Inspector</fen> achieves after the process of verification.
<ex>His involvement in the action has subsequently been <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>confirmed</t>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Inspector</fen> hopes to bring about by going through the verification.
<ex>I spent a few minutes <t>confirming</t> his visa number <fex name="pur">just to make him sweat</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>: <ex><fex name="Medium">Chapter four</fex> <t>confirms</t> the reader 's suspicions completely.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>A tool or instrument used by the <fen>Inspector</fen> in the verification process.</def-root>

FE.name: Condition
FE.definition: <def-root>The conditions under which the the verification will occur.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a characteristic of the verification event. </def-root>

FE.name: Communicative_force
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes where the verificiation event takes place. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for the state of the verification event. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: uitkijken.v
lexUnit.definition: voorzichtig zijn, je aandacht erbij houden

lexUnit.name: letten.v
lexUnit.definition: bijzondere aandacht aan iets besteden, toezicht houden
